snippet: Basing legislative districts on total population remains the most practical way to ensure fairness, including protections of racial equality.
abstract: Editorial opposes effort, under consideration in Supreme Court case Evenwel v Abbott, to base Texas voting districts on number of eligible votes, rather than number of people; holds that total population is most practical measure for determining districts; asserts proposed change would diminish power of urban areas, where minorities live, in favor of Republican-leaning rural areas; calls for justices to reject attempt by conservative activists to undermine racial equality.
lead_paragraph: Basing legislative districts on total population remains the most practical way to ensure fairness, including protections of racial equality.

headline.print_headline: The Court Takes Up One Person, One Vote
headline.main: The Court Takes Up One Person, One Vote
